page.title: 11Two annual events in Rye
page.content: THE RAFT RACE:Every summer a 1\-mile -long raft race is held on the river. It starts at the Strand turning and finishes at the harbour. There are usually about 35 entries. Some of it is for charity. It is very funny and a nice occasion, with some rafts looking very strange and people wearing amusing costumes. There is a prize at the end,but taking part is much more important. BONFIRE CELEBRATIONS:Every year on a Saturday around Guy Fawkes' day the Rye Bonfire Society organises a torchlight procession through the streets to the salts where the bonfire is lit. Bonfire societies from other towns take part and each group dresses in fantastic costumes to do with its chosen theme.
